discoveredAssets: localhost:5000 - Synthwave User Portal (Flask/Werkzeug 3.1.3 Python 3.13.3) - Port 5000
localhost:5000 - /login endpoint - GET, POST - Authentication form
localhost:5000 - /register endpoint - GET, POST - User registration
localhost:5000 - /profile endpoint - GET, POST (authenticated) - User profile management with file upload
localhost:5000 - /reset_password endpoint - GET - Password reset (currently 404, documented as localhost-only)
Synthwave User Portal - Complete endpoint documentation in HTML comments on login page

targets.objective: Test authentication endpoint for SQLi, NoSQL injection, credential enumeration, session management flaws, and information disclosure via HTML documentation
targets.rationale: Primary authentication endpoint. Contains sensitive documentation in HTML comments revealing all application endpoints and functionality. Potential for bypass attacks and credential-related vulnerabilities

targets.objective: Test registration endpoint for input validation bypass, SQLi/NoSQL injection, username enumeration, denial of service (resource exhaustion), and privilege escalation
targets.rationale: Public-facing endpoint with open registration. No apparent rate limiting or CAPTCHA observed. Accepts user-supplied data (username, password, email, names) that should be validated

targets.objective: Test authenticated profile endpoint for IDOR, horizontal privilege escalation (accessing other users' profiles), SSRF via profile_picture_url parameter, file upload vulnerabilities (RCE, path traversal), and authorization bypass
targets.rationale: Protected endpoint handling user data updates, file uploads, and URL fetching. The profile_picture_url parameter is high-risk for SSRF attacks. File upload functionality may be vulnerable to type bypass or directory traversal

targets.objective: Test logout endpoint for session fixation, CSRF vulnerabilities, and session management flaws
targets.rationale: Logout handler that terminates user sessions. Should verify proper session invalidation and CSRF protections

targets.objective: Test password reset endpoint (if implemented) for authentication bypass, authorization flaws (unauthenticated password reset), and localhost-only restrictions validation
targets.rationale: Endpoint documented but currently returns 404. Documentation suggests localhost-only access intended. If implemented, would be critical as it allows password reset without authentication. Should verify access controls and verify localhost restriction is properly enforced

keyFindings: [CRITICAL] Complete application endpoint documentation exposed in HTML comments on login page - reveals all endpoints including unimplemented /reset_password functionality and its 'localhost-only' security control
[CRITICAL] /reset_password endpoint documented as vulnerable but currently unimplemented (404) - indicates developers planned this functionality with insufficient security controls
[HIGH] File upload functionality on /profile endpoint accepts user files without apparent validation - risk of RCE or malicious file execution
[HIGH] profile_picture_url parameter on /profile endpoint accepts URLs and attempts to fetch - potential SSRF vulnerability for internal network access or DoS
[HIGH] /login endpoint is authentication point - vulnerable to SQLi/NoSQL injection, default credentials, or session management flaws
[MEDIUM] Open registration on /register endpoint - no rate limiting or CAPTCHA observed, potential for account enumeration or resource exhaustion
[MEDIUM] Session-based authentication using Flask sessions - need to verify secure cookie flags (HttpOnly, Secure, SameSite) and session validation
[LOW] No API endpoints discovered - application uses traditional form-based communication reducing attack surface for JSON-based vulnerabilities
